text:
Viola is a city in Sedgwick County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 130 people lived there.
History.
Viola had its start when the Englewood branch of the Santa Fe railroad was extended to that point.
The first post office at Viola was created in 1877, but the post office was called Peotone until 1899.
Geography.
Viola is at (37.483526, -97.644918). It is southwest of Wichita on Highway 42 at the intersection of Highway 49. The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 130 people, 51 households, and 37 families living in Viola.
Education.
Viola is served by USD 356 Conway Springs.
